00050 function PrintAfterHoursForm()
00051 {
00052     global $View, $IMG_PATH, $Row;
00053 
00055     $weekdays= array(
00056         //0 => _('Sun'),
00057         1 => _TITLE2('Mon'),
00058         2 => _TITLE2('Tue'),
00059         3 => _TITLE2('Wed'),
00060         4 => _TITLE2('Thu'),
00061         5 => _TITLE2('Fri'),
00062         6 => _TITLE2('Sat'),
00063         7 => _TITLE2('Sun'),
00064         );
00065 
00066     if ($View->Controller($output, 'GetAfterHours')) {
00067         list($businessdaysdisabled, $holidaysdisabled, $flushdisabled,
00068             $startmin, $starthour, $endmin, $endhour,
00069             $businessdays, $holidays, $flushdays)= unserialize($output[0]);
00070     }
00071     
00072     if ($View->Controller($output, 'GetAfterHoursPfRules')) {
00073         if (count($output) > 0) {
00074             $status= _TITLE('enabled');
00075             $button= 'Disable';
00076             $imgfile= 'run.png';
00077         }
00078         else {
00079             $status= _TITLE('disabled');
00080             $button= 'Enable';
00081             $imgfile= 'stop.png';
00082         }
00083     }
00084     
00085     $class= $Row++ % 2 == 0 ? 'evenline' : 'oddline';
00086     ?>
00087     <tr class="<?php echo $class ?>">
00088         <td class="title">
00089             <img src="<?php echo $IMG_PATH.$imgfile ?>" name="AfterHours" alt="AfterHours" border="0" align="absmiddle">
00090             <?php echo _TITLE2('After hours').' '.$status.':' ?>
00091         </td>
00092         <td>
00093             <form action="<?php echo $_SERVER['PHP_SELF'] ?>" method="post">
00094                 <input type="submit" name="<?php echo $button ?>" value="<?php echo _($button) ?>"/>
00095             </form>
00096         </td>
00097         <td class="none">
00098             <?php PrintHelpBox(_HELPBOX('This button allows you to <b>manually</b> enable or disable after hours rules. Note that the rules are activated or deactivated immediately, irrespective of the after hours definitions below. For example, you can use this button to shutdown after hours rules in case of an emergency.')) ?>
00099         </td>
00100     </tr>
00101     <?php
00102     $class= $Row++ % 2 == 0 ? 'evenline' : 'oddline';
00103     ?>
00104     <form action="<?php echo $_SERVER['PHP_SELF'] ?>" method="post">
00105         <tr class="<?php echo $class ?>">
00106             <td class="titlegrouptop">
00107                 <?php
00108                 echo _TITLE('Business Days').':';
00109                 ?>
00110             </td>
00111             <td>
00112                 <table>
00113                     <tr>
00114                         <td class="pfafterhours">
00115                             <?php
00116                             foreach ($weekdays as $num => $day) {
00117                                 $checked= in_array($num, $businessdays) ? 'checked' : '';
00118                                 $checked= $businessdaysdisabled ? $checked.' disabled' : $checked;
00119                                 ?>
00120                                 <label><input name="BusinessDays[]" type="checkbox" <?php echo $checked ?> value="<?php echo $num ?>"><?php echo _($day) ?></label>
00121                                 <?php
00122                             }
00123                             ?>
00124                         </td>
00125                         <td class="pfafterhoursbutton">
00126                             <?php
00127                             $button= $businessdaysdisabled ? 'Enable' : 'Disable';
00128                             ?>
00129                             <input type="submit" name="<?php echo $button.'BusinessDays' ?>" value="<?php echo _($button) ?>"/>
00130                         </td>
00131                     </tr>
00132                 </table>
00133             </td>
00134             <td class="none" rowspan="3">
00135                 <?php PrintHelpBox(_HELPBOX('Definition of after hours can be set here. If you modify any of these definitions, you should click the Apply button.
00136 
00137 Note that when you enable Business Days or Holidays, the related rules will become active according to these definitions. If you don\'t want to use the after hours feature of ComixWall, make sure these definitions are disabled.
00138 
00139 Business hours configuration is meaningful only for business days.')) ?>
00140             </td>
00141         </tr>
00142         <tr class="<?php echo $class ?>">
00143             <td class="titlegroupmiddle">
00144                 <?php
00145                 echo _TITLE('Holidays').':';
00146                 ?>
00147             </td>
00148             <td>
00149                 <table>
00150                     <tr>
00151                         <td class="pfafterhours">
00152                             <?php
00153                             foreach ($weekdays as $num => $day) {
00154                                 $checked= in_array($num, $holidays) ? 'checked' : '';
00155                                 $checked= $holidaysdisabled ? $checked.' disabled' : $checked;
00156                                 ?>
00157                                 <label><input name="Holidays[]" type="checkbox" <?php echo $checked ?> value="<?php echo $num ?>"><?php echo _($day) ?></label>

00189                             :

00217 function PrintPrivIPsForm()
00218 {
00219     global $View, $Row;
00220     
00221     $class= $Row++ % 2 == 0 ? 'evenline' : 'oddline';
00222     ?>
00223     <tr class="<?php echo $class ?>">
00224         <td class="title">
00225             <?php echo _TITLE('Privileged IPs').':' ?>
00226         </td>
00227         <td>
00228             <form action="<?php echo $_SERVER['PHP_SELF'] ?>" method="post">
00229                 <input style="display:none;" type="submit" name="Add" value="<?php echo _CONTROL('Add') ?>"/>
00230                 <select name="PrivilegedIPs[]" multiple style="width: 200px; height: 100px;">
00231                     <?php
00232                     if ($View->Controller($ips, 'GetAllowedIps')) {
00233                         foreach ($ips as $ip) {
00234                             ?>
00235                             <option value="<?php echo $ip ?>"><?php echo $ip ?></option>
00236                             <?php
00237                         }
00238                     }
00239                     ?>
00240                 </select>
00241                 <input type="submit" name="Delete" value="<?php echo _CONTROL('Delete') ?>"/><br />
00242                 <input type="text" name="PrivilegedIPToAdd" style="width: 200px;" maxlength="18"/>
00243                 <input type="submit" name="Add" value="<?php echo _CONTROL('Add') ?>"/>
00244             </form>
00245         </td>
00246         <td class="none">
00247             <?php 
00248             PrintHelpBox(_HELPBOX('Privileged IPs have access to more services than other IPs, such as instant messaging and file sharing. Normally, the ports of such services should remain blocked for users who do not need them.'));
00249             ?>
00250         </td>
00251     </tr>
00252     <?php
00253 }

00259 function PrintRestrictedIPsForm()
00260 {
00261     global $View, $Row;
00262     
00263     $class= $Row++ % 2 == 0 ? 'evenline' : 'oddline';
00264     ?>
00265     <tr class="<?php echo $class ?>">
00266         <td class="title">
00267             <?php echo _TITLE('Restricted IPs').':' ?>
00268         </td>
00269         <td>
00270             <form action="<?php echo $_SERVER['PHP_SELF'] ?>" method="post">
00271                 <input style="display:none;" type="submit" name="Add" value="<?php echo _CONTROL('Add') ?>"/>
00272                 <select name="RestrictedIPs[]" multiple style="width: 200px; height: 100px;">
00273                     <?php
00274                     if ($View->Controller($ips, 'GetRestrictedIps')) {
00275                         foreach ($ips as $ip) {
00276                             ?>
00277                             <option value="<?php echo $ip ?>"><?php echo $ip ?></option>
00278                             <?php
00279                         }
00280                     }
00281                     ?>
00282                 </select>
00283                 <input type="submit" name="Delete" value="<?php echo _CONTROL('Delete') ?>"/><br />
00284                 <input type="text" name="RestrictedIPToAdd" style="width: 200px;" maxlength="18"/>
00285                 <input type="submit" name="Add" value="<?php echo _CONTROL('Add') ?>"/>
00286             </form>
00287         </td>
00288         <td class="none">
00289             <?php
00290             PrintHelpBox(_HELPBOX('This is the opposite of Privileged IPs. You can enter IP ranges as well, e.g. 192.168.1.0/24.'));
00291             ?>
00292         </td>
00293     </tr>
00294     <?php
00295 }
00296 
00297 if ($_POST) {
00298     if (array_key_exists('Add', $_POST) || array_key_exists('Delete', $_POST)) {
00299         if ($_POST['Add']) {
00300             if ($_POST['PrivilegedIPToAdd']) {
00301                 $View->Controller($Output, 'AddAllowedIp', $_POST['PrivilegedIPToAdd']);
00302             }
00303             else if ($_POST['RestrictedIPToAdd']) {
00304                 $View->Controller($Output, 'AddRestrictedIp', $_POST['RestrictedIPToAdd']);
00305             }
00306         }
00307         else if ($_POST['Delete']) {
00308             if ($_POST['PrivilegedIPs']) {
00309                 foreach ($_POST['PrivilegedIPs'] as $Ip) {
00310                     $View->Controller($Output, 'DelAllowedIp', $Ip);
00311                 }
00312             }
00313             if ($_POST['RestrictedIPs']) {
00314                 foreach ($_POST['RestrictedIPs'] as $Ip) {
00315                     $View->Controller($Output, 'DelRestrictedIp', $Ip);
00316                 }
00317             }
00318         }
00320         $View->Controller($Output, 'ApplyPfRules');
00321         cwwui_syslog(LOG_NOTICE, __FILE__, __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, 'PF rules reloaded: RestrictedIPs table changed');
00322     }
00323     else if ($_POST['Enable']) {
00324         $View->Controller($Output, 'EnableAfterHours');
00325         cwwui_syslog(LOG_NOTICE, __FILE__, __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, 'AfterHours enabled');
00326     }
00327     else if ($_POST['Disable']) {
00328         $View->Controller($Output, 'DisableAfterHours');
00329         cwwui_syslog(LOG_NOTICE, __FILE__, __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, 'AfterHours disabled');
00330     }
00331     else if ($_POST['EnableBusinessDays']) {
00332         $View->Controller($Output, 'EnableAfterHoursBusinessDays');
00333     }
00334     else if ($_POST['DisableBusinessDays']) {
00335         $View->Controller($Output, 'DisableAfterHoursBusinessDays');
00336     }
00337     else if ($_POST['EnableHolidays']) {
00338         $View->Controller($Output, 'EnableAfterHoursHolidays');
00339     }
00340     else if ($_POST['DisableHolidays']) {
00341         $View->Controller($Output, 'DisableAfterHoursHolidays');
00342     }
00343     else if ($_POST['Apply']) {
00344         if ($_POST['BusinessDays']) {
00345             $BusinessDaysList= implode(',', $_POST['BusinessDays']);
00346         }
00347         else {
00349             $View->Controller($Output, 'DisableAfterHoursBusinessDays');
00350         }
00351 
00352         if ($_POST['Holidays']) {
00353             $HolidaysList= implode(',', $_POST['Holidays']);
00354         }
00355         else {
00357             $View->Controller($Output, 'DisableAfterHoursHolidays');
00358         }
00359         $View->Controller($Output, 'ApplyAfterHours', $_POST['StartHour'], $_POST['StartMin'], $_POST['EndHour'], $_POST['EndMin'], $BusinessDaysList, $HolidaysList);
00360         cwwui_syslog(LOG_NOTICE, __FILE__, __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, 'AfterHours changed');
00361     }
00362 }

00364 require_once($VIEW_PATH.'header.php');
00365 ?>

00367     <?php
00368     $Row= 1;

00371     PrintRestrictedIPsForm();

00374 <?php
00375 PrintHelpWindow(_HELPWINDOW('This page provides basic Packet Filter configuration. Packet filter rules can be modified under the Rules tab.
00376 
00377 OpenBSD/pf is a powerful and flexible stateful packet filter. Among many advanced features of pf are:<ul><li>Stateful inspection</li><li>Network Address Translation (NAT)</li><li>Packet normalization</li><li>Spoof protection</li><li>Packet queueing and bandwidth management</li><li>Traffic shaping</li><li>Policy routing</li><li>Load balancing, and much more</li></ul>You can add an IP range to the restricted IPs list, and enter individual IP addresses or subnets to privileged IPs list, to define exceptions over the restricted IP range. Or visa-versa.'));
00378 require_once($VIEW_PATH.'footer.php');
00379 ?>
